byline.contributor: Marc Tracy contributed reporting from Cleveland.

abstract: Karen Crouse On College Basketball column contends that the true value of the NCAA tournament games is the perspective, growth and memories that March Madness bestows on its young players.
lead_paragraph: To the fans filling out brackets, the N.C.A.A. tournament is a zero-sum game. But long after they forget the names of the winners, players will cherish their memories, and the bonds they forged.

headline.main: In the N.C.A.A. Tournament, Games Are Big, but Life Is Bigger
headline.print_headline: Games Are Big, but Life Is Bigger

snippet: To the fans filling out brackets, the N.C.A.A. tournament is a zero-sum game. But long after they forget the names of the winners, players will cherish their memories, and the bonds they forged.
